page.title: 15Monmouth's Local Paper
page.content: The{"Monmouthshire Beacon"}serves the town and a large rural area. Founded in 1837 it was owned privately until 1980.An editor and reporter and fifteen others are{employed}on this weekly paper.{Printing}is done by the modern "Photo Composition" method.The paper is available on Fridays,and recently a{"Beacon Extra"}on Tuesdays.{Adverts}make up half the paper and five people deal solely with setting the advert spaces. The leading articles deal mainly with {local issues,}much of the news though is sent in by{local organisations}such as W.I's, Schools, reports from council meetings, school governors' meetings and the like. { Local people}are very much "Beacon" readers moreso than the larger county paper.{Circulation}is about 5,500 copies weekly.
